programme.title: Bailout at 43,000
programme.desc: 1957. Drama. Director: Francis D. Lyon. Stars John Payne, Karen Steele and Paul Kelly. The story of the men who volunteered to be test subjects for the new ejection system for a new bomber plane. [S]

programme.title: Crime of Passion
programme.desc: 1957. Drama. Directed by Gerd Oswald. Stars Barbara Stanwyck, Sterling Hayden & Raymond Burr. A police detective's ambitious wife will stop at nothing to help advance her husband's career. [S]

programme.title: Kings Go Forth
programme.desc: 1958. Drama. Directed by Delmer Daves. Stars Frank Sinatra, Tony Curtis & Natalie Wood. In France during WWII, two American soldiers become romantic rivals when they fall for the same woman. [S]

programme.title: Star Performance: The Last Voyage
programme.desc: 1953. Drama. Directed by Robert Florey. Stars Charles Boyer, Jack Lambert & Walter Sande. A sea captain on his final voyage discovers that a time bomb has been planted on his ship.

programme.title: The Case of Charles Peace
programme.desc: 1949. Drama. Made at Merton Park Studios, based on a true story, directed by Norman Lee. The film recounts the exploits through the trial of Charles Peace. Starring Michael Martin-Harvey. [S]

programme.title: The Madame Gambles
programme.desc: 1951. Comedy. The owner of a dress shop gambles the shop away to her bookie who inherits, not only the shop, but the manager. Directed by Maclean Rogers. Starring Richard Hearne and Petula Clark. [S]

programme.title: Star Performance: The Collar
programme.desc: 1955. Drama. Directed by Roy Kellino. Stars David Niven, Barton MacLane & Walter Coy. A priest, held captive by a tribe, attempts to save their lives after they are threatened by the military.

programme.title: I Remember Mama
programme.desc: 1948. Drama. Starring Irene Dunne, Barbara Bel Geddes and Oskar Homolka. A Norwegian immigrant family in 1910, San Francisco... Mamma runs the Pennywise household. 5 Oscar Nominations. [S]

programme.title: Mon Oncle
programme.desc: 1958. Comedy. Directed by and stars Jacques Tati. With Jean-Pierre Zola & Lucien Frégis. Monsieur Hulot visits the technological world of his sister, brother-in-law, and nephew, but can't fit in. [S]

programme.title: Look At Life Clearway for Ships
programme.desc: 1966. A different look at the life of dredgers and how they prevent our waterways from silting up.

programme.title: The Writing on the Wall
programme.desc: Mike Read continues to explore the country to find the Blue Plaques and the unique stories behind them. This episode features Fred Perry, Herbert Chapman, Archibald Leitch and Mark Knopfler. [S]

programme.title: Miss Robin Hood
programme.desc: 1952. Comedy. Henry is a mild man who writes adventure stories for his girls. All is fine until he meets Miss Honey! Starring Richard Hearne & Margaret Rutherford. Directed by John Guillermin. [S]

programme.title: The Ghost Goes West
programme.desc: 1935. Comedy. Directed by René Clair. Stars Robert Donat, Jean Parker & Elsa Lanchester. A haunted Scottish castle is sold, dismantled and transported to Florida, bringing the ghost along with it. [S]

programme.title: The Disappearance of Flight 412
programme.desc: 1974. Sci-fi. Directed by Jud Taylor. Stars Glenn Ford & Bradford Dillman. When Flight 412 witnesses the disappearance of two fighter jets, a military group attempts to cover up the incident. [S]

programme.title: Strange But True
programme.desc: Past Life/Pluckley. 1996. Michael Aspel presents more unusual tales, including a man who searches for his other life and a look at Pluckley, believed to be the most haunted village in England. [S]

programme.title: Cellar Club with Caroline Munro
programme.desc: It's a dark night down in the Cellar Club but join Caroline Munro as she introduces the first offering of the night, the perplexing 1971 episode Doomwatch - The Logicians. [S]

programme.title: Doomwatch
programme.desc: The Logicians. 1971. Stars John Nolan & Irene Prador. A powerful antibiotic formula has been stolen near a school full of gifted teens. Are they responsible, and is computer technology to blame? [S]

programme.title: Cellar Club with Caroline Munro
programme.desc: This cursed night continues with the mind bending 1972 horror Demons of the Mind, about the monsters that lurk and torture the agonised mind. Starring Shane Briant and Robert Hardy. [S]

programme.title: Demons of the Mind
programme.desc: 1972. Horror. Directed by Peter Sykes. Stars Shane Briant, Robert Hardy & Gillian Hills. Believing his family is cursed, a baron keeps his two children imprisoned following the death of his wife. [S]

programme.title: Cellar Club with Caroline Munro
programme.desc: Get ready for more intriguing features as Caroline Munro delves into next week's picks. [S]

programme.title: Confessions of a Driving Instructor
programme.desc: 1976. Comedy. Director Norman Cohen. Stars Robin Askwith, Anthony Booth & Liz Fraser. The misadventures of Timothy Lea and his brother-in-law when they set up a driving school business.

programme.desc: 1976. Comedy. Director Norman Cohen. Stars Robin Askwith, Anthony Booth & Liz Fraser. The misadventures of Timothy Lea and his brother-in-law when they set up a driving school business.

programme.title: The Whole Truth
programme.desc: 1958. Drama. Directed by John Guillermin & Dan Cohen. Stars Stewart Granger, Donna Reed & George Sanders. A film producer becomes a suspect to the stabbing of an actress after his recent affair. [S]

programme.title: The Diamond Wizard
programme.desc: 1954. Crime. Director: Montgomery Tully. Stars Dennis O'Keefe, Philip Friend & Alan Wheatley. A U.S. agent teams up with a Scotland Yard inspector to find thieves who are creating fake diamonds. [S]

programme.title: A Lifetime Ago with The Baim Collection
programme.desc: Enchanted Cities. 1957. Narrated by Kenneth Macleod. A tour of the beautiful Italian cities of Florence and Venice.

programme.title: Time To Remember
programme.desc: The End of the Beginning. 1964. Narrated by Stanley Holloway. It's 1942; America gears herself for total war, the G.I.'s are seen in London, and the Japanese advance across the Pacific. [S]

programme.title: Smart Alec
programme.desc: 1951. Drama. Director: John Guillermin. Stars Peter Reynolds, Leslie Dwyer, Mercy Haystead & Charles Hawtrey. An unscrupulous bounder is to become the heir to a large fortune. [S]

programme.title: Dick Tracy's Dilemma
programme.desc: 1947. Crime mystery. Directed by John Rawlins and starring Ralph Byrd, Lyle Latell and Kay Christopher. Tracy investigates the theft of fur coats and an insurance swindle linked to a hook handed thug.

programme.title: Space Patrol
programme.desc: The Glowing Eggs of Titan. 1963. Stars Murray Kash, Libby Morris & Ronnie Stevens. Husky's discovery of a luminous egg on Titan could prove to be the solution to the Martian energy crisis. [S]

programme.title: Batman
programme.desc: Green Ice. 1966. Stars Adam West, Otto Preminger & Dee Hartford. Mr. Freeze kidnaps Miss Iceland from the Gotham City Beauty Contest to freeze her to 50 degrees below zero and marry her. [S]

programme.title: Richard the Lionheart
programme.desc: The Bride. 1962. Stars Dermot Walsh, Trader Faulkner & Susan Shaw. Urged by his counsellors to marry, Richard sets out in disguise to visit the home of Princess Alice. [S]

programme.title: Supercar
programme.desc: Grounded. 1961. Stars David Graham & George Murcell. The Supercar project has moved to England for the installation of new control circuits, but a disgruntled employee steals the units. [S]

programme.title: One Hour To Zero
programme.desc: 1976. Adventure. Directed by Jeremy Summers. Stars Dudley Sutton, Andrew Ashby & Toby Bridge. Paul and Steve find their village deserted after warnings of an explosion lead to an evacuation. [S]

programme.title: The Adventures of Robin Hood
programme.desc: The Champion. 1960. Stars Richard Greene & Jack Allen. After the death of her father, Marian reveals that her estate will be taken over by Sir Quentin, but Robin suspects the Sheriff is scheming. [S]

programme.title: Attack from Space
programme.desc: 1965. Sci-fi. Directed by Koreyoshi Akasaka, Teruo Ishii & Akira Mitsuwa. Stars Ken Utsui & Sachihiro Ohsawa. The rulers of planet Emerald send superhero Starman to protect Earth from evil aliens. [S]

programme.title: One Step Beyond
programme.desc: The Secret. 1959. Starring: John Newland, Maria Palmer & Robert Douglas. A young woman is left alone with her domineering husband. She soon invents an imaginary lover who loves and comforts her. [S]

programme.title: Dick Barton: Special Agent
programme.desc: 1979. Writer: Julian Bond. Mr Parkes (Terence Seward), a playboy, & Mrs Aston (Marsha Fitzalan), wife of a Whitehall official, are threatened by the Drew Brothers (Ernie Drew by Bernard Kay).

programme.title: Captain Scarlet and the Mysterons
programme.desc: Treble Cross. 1968. Stars Janna Hill, Jeremy Wilkin & Cy Grant. Captain Black attempts to kill and reconstruct test pilot Major Gravener as part of a plan to attack the world capital, Futura City.

programme.title: Look At Life Down to Earth
programme.desc: 1966. An exciting look at some of the girls of the WRAF who trekked into the jungle, and who also take part in a jungle survival exercise, parachute jumps, and sub-aqua diving.

programme.title: Jack the Giant Killer
programme.desc: 1962. Fantasy. Directed by Nathan Juran. Stars Kerwin Mathews, Judi Meredith, & Torin Thatcher. The treacherous Pendragon plots to gain the throne of Cornwall. Can anyone stop the evil sorcerer? [S]

programme.title: Look At Life Hidden Strength
programme.desc: 1967. A captivating look at the hidden exports of the city of London and all the different investments that are made.

programme.title: Paratrooper

programme.title: Z-Cars
programme.desc: Debris. 1978. Stars John Collin, Brian Grellis & Graham Ashley. When the Newtown Marriage Guidance Centre is burnt down, Haggar and Bowker start investigating its clients. [S]

programme.title: A Family At War
programme.desc: 1971. I Can Be Happy Can't I? Created by John Finch. Stars Colin Douglas & Shelagh Fraser. Margaret spends her time with eligible widower Michael Armstrong. Edwin comes to a decision. (S2, E02) [S]

programme.title: Ship of Fools
programme.desc: 1965. Drama. Directed by Stanley Kramer. Stars Vivien Leigh & Simone Signoret. An eclectic group of passenger's board a ship bound for pre-war Germany, forming a microcosm of 1930s society. [S]

programme.title: Supermarket Secrets Revealed
